subject: Science
title: Natural Selection Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Natural Selection Explained.

hook.text: Nature doesn't design organisms. It just kills the ones that don't work.

buildup.text: In any population, individuals vary. Some run faster, see better, or resist disease.

discovery.text: Those with advantages survive longer and reproduce more. Their traits spread.

twist.text: It's not 'survival of the fittest' meaning strongest. Fittest means best adapted to the environment.

climax.text: Change the environment, and yesterday's winners become today's losers.

punchline.text: Natural selection isn't about being strong. It's about fitting the world you're in.

quiz.question: What does 'survival of the fittest' actually mean?
options: Best adapted to the current environment
